title: Commute Cost & Time Value Calculator
description: Calculate the true annual cost of your commute, including fuel, vehicle wear, and the implicit value of your time.
methodSummary: Multiply daily round-trip by working days per year for total distance and time.
Calculate direct vehicle costs using the IRS standard rate or custom input.
Multiply total commute hours by your subjective hourly time value.
assumptions: Commute time and distance are consistent.
Vehicle costs include fuel, maintenance, and depreciation (IRS rate is a good proxy).
insights: A 30-minute commute (one way) costs roughly 240 hours per year.
Choosing a remote job with the same salary is effectively a significant 'raise' in time value.

faqs.q: What is the IRS standard mileage rate?
faqs.a: For 2024, the IRS standard business mileage rate is 67 cents per mile, which accounts for fuel, insurance, and wear.

faqs.q: How should I value my time?
faqs.a: A common method is to use your hourly wage, or half of it if you find the commute relaxing (unlikely!).
You should add tolls into your 'Fuel/Wear Cost' per unit or adjust the result manually.

faqs.q: Can I save money by moving closer?
faqs.a: Usually, yes, but often rent increases. Use this tool to see if the rent hike is offset by commute savings.

faqs.q: How do I calculate public transport costs?
faqs.a: You can set the distance cost to your monthly transit pass divided by annual mileage, or simply focus on the 'Time Value' loss.
Several studies show that long commutes increase stress and reduce sleep. This tool helps put a financial figure on that personal cost.

useCases: Deciding between two job offers with different locations.
Evaluating the true value of a Remote vs. Hybrid role.
Calculating potential savings from moving house.
